title: As Ether staking yields fall, protocols will have to get creative - DLNews

The inverse relationship between staked Ether and its yield was a design compromise between two choices with flaws, and an equilibrium may be reached if yields plummet.

title: HSBC Hong Kong Launches Support for Bitcoin and Ethereum ETFs - Yahoo Finance
summary: HSBC Hong Kong has launched support for Bitcoin and Ethereum ETFs on its "Easy Invest" mobile app, allowing customers to trade digital asset derivatives as securities. This is the first bank in Hong Kong to offer such products, which provide exposure to Bitcoin and Ethereum futures through derivative contracts listed on commodity exchanges. The ETFs are managed by CSOP Asset Management and Samsung Asset Management Hong Kong, and offer a transparent and easy way for investors to capture the performance of these digital assets. The move is seen as a way for HSBC to expand local users' exposure to cryptocurrencies in Hong Kong, and to offer a safer and more regulated option for investors compared to unregulated exchanges.

title: What Has Been Happening with Ethereum in 2018? - Cryptonews
summary: Ethereum has experienced a tumultuous 2018, with the value of its token (ETH) dropping significantly since mid-January. This decline has been attributed to increased competition from other smart contract platforms, as well as blockchain startups holding Initial Coin Offerings (ICOs) needing to sell their ETH to pay expenses in fiat currency. The introduction of Application-Specific Integrated Circuit (ASIC) miners for Ethereum has also raised concerns about centralization, although Ethereum founder Vitalik Buterin is not concerned. Buterin has proposed capping the total supply of ETH at 120 million, which could potentially lead to a rally in the token's price.

Additionally, the staking participation rate is expected to rise, resulting in more unstaked ETH tokens being removed from circulation. These tailwinds could lead to a significant increase in ETH price, potentially outperforming Bitcoin during the next crypto bull market.

title: Ethereum Constantinople Upgrade: What is it All About? - Cryptonews
summary: The Ethereum Constantinople upgrade is scheduled to take place on February 27th, with five Ethereum Improvement Proposals (EIPs) aimed at improving the quality of life, efficiency, and speed of the network. The upgrade will reduce the influx of new ether and make mining less profitable, but it will also lower the cost of running the network. The changes are expected to be positive for the valuation of Ether in the short term, but the price could drop following the hard fork. The upgrade includes EIP 1234, which delays the difficulty bomb and reduces the reward for mining, which could impact miners' profitability. The community is divided on the impact of the upgrade, with some miners not happy with the changes.

title: This Ethereum Layer-2 is on Fire – Here's What That Means for ETH Price - Cryptonews
summary: Arbitrum, an Ethereum layer-2 scaling solution, is experiencing rapid growth, with daily fees reaching $300,000 and transaction volumes surpassing Ethereum network transactions. The protocol has seen a 700% increase in daily transactions since the start of the year, with over 1 million transactions per day. This growth has led to an increase in daily active addresses, unique addresses registered on the protocol, and TVL in DeFi protocols. Analysts believe this growth is bullish for Ethereum, as it addresses two of the network's biggest drawbacks: low transaction throughput and high network fees. As layer-2 solutions like Arbitrum can process 40,000 transactions per second, they can compete with more centralized but scalable layer-1 competitors while keeping dApps and projects within Ethereum's "zone of sovereignty." The growth of layer-2 solutions also contributes directly to Ethereum network growth, making the recent surge in Arbitrum's popularity a positive for ETH.

title: Why Ethereum Layer-2 Optimism Has Changed Its Name - DailyCoin
summary: Optimism, a prominent Ethereum Layer-2 scaling solution, has changed its name to OP Mainnet. The team behind the protocol explained the change, saying there was a need to distinguish between the blockchain and the rest of the organization. The name "Optimism" will still be used in the Optimism Foundation's name, but the chain itself is now called OP Mainnet. The name change is intended to reflect the protocol's values of decentralization and inclusiveness better. Some users may find the new name confusing, as "OP" is also the token's ticker. However, the change is seen as a net positive for the Ethereum Layer-2 community.

title: How to Use Layer-2 Solutions to Save on Ethereum Fees: Arbitrum - Cryptonews
summary: Arbitrum is an Ethereum L2 scaling solution that helps increase the speed and scalability of Ethereum smart contracts while providing additional privacy features. It allows developers to run Ethereum applications without compromising the security of the Ethereum network. To use Arbitrum to save on Ethereum gas fees, users can set up Arbitrum on a self-custody wallet like MetaMask and use the Arbitrum Bridge to send ETH to the Arbitrum layer. Several popular crypto applications are already supporting Arbitrum, including wallets, centralized exchanges, and decentralized apps. While Ethereum is facing scaling challenges, L2 solutions like Arbitrum could help it retain its market-leading position.

title: Will Ethereum Reach Serenity This Year? - Cryptonews
summary:
Ethereum is expected to launch its major network upgrade, Ethereum 2.0 (also known as Serenity), in phases. The first phase, Phase 0, has already been launched with the Beacon Chain and Shard Chains, and the next phase is expected to be launched in the near future. The upgrade will bring significant changes to the Ethereum network, including the transition from the proof-of-work (PoW) consensus algorithm to proof-of-stake (PoS), the introduction of sharding, and the launch of a new virtual machine.

The exact date for the next phase is not clear, but according to Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin, it is months away. The upgrade is expected to significantly improve the scalability of the Ethereum network, allowing for more transactions and greater security.

In related news, Ethereum is currently trading at around $143, down 1% in a day, trimming its weekly gains to 1.5%. The price has been relatively stable in recent weeks, with some fluctuations.

title: Ethereum's Deflation Rate Keeps Rising – Here's What That Means for the ETH Price - Cryptonews
summary: Ethereum's deflation rate, which measures the rate at which the Ether (ETH) supply is decreasing, has been rising and could continue to accelerate due to increasing network activity. The annualized daily net inflation rate of Ether hit a record low of -2.772% last Tuesday, and as of Sunday, the rate had risen to around -1%. This is driven by higher gas fees, which are burned as a result of Ethereum Improvement Proposal (EIP) 1559, removing the tokens from circulation permanently. As the base gas fee rises, the ETH burn rate also rises, which could lead to further deflation. Additionally, the total amount of capital locked within smart contracts on the Ethereum network has been rising, and network activity levels are expected to continue increasing as investors dive back into Decentralized Finance (DeFi) amid improved market sentiment. This could lead to a staggering 5.5% deflation rate if the EIP 1559 burn rate returns to its early 2022 highs.

SAP believes digital money can overcome these pain points and plans to integrate blockchain-based payment processes into its ERP solutions. The company is also exploring other crypto solutions for payment scenarios like commerce and employee payments.

title: Founder Vitalik Buterin Reveals 5 Features That Excite Him the Most About Ethereum – The Last One May Surprise You - Cryptonews
summary:
Vitalik Buterin, co-founder of Ethereum, has shared his excitement about five features of the Ethereum ecosystem that he finds particularly promising. These include:

1. Money: Cryptocurrency has the potential to provide a lifeline in countries with limited access to global financial systems and extreme inflation. Ethereum's Merge has significantly improved transaction speeds and stability, making it a more reliable option for accepting transactions with fewer confirmations.
2. Decentralized finance (DeFi): While DeFi started as a "limited but honorable" concept, it has evolved into an overcapitalized monster that relied on unsustainable forms of yield farming. However, DeFi is now setting down into a stable medium, with a focus on improving security and on a few applications that are notably valuable.
3. Identity: Buterin believes that centralized platforms for creating and managing identities will not work, and instead, an organic approach with many projects working on specific tasks that are individually valuable and adding interoperability over time is more likely to succeed.

title: 3 Ways to Invest in Ethereum Without Buying ETH - Cryptonews
summary:
Here are three ways to invest in Ethereum without buying the cryptocurrency directly:

1. Grayscale Ethereum Trust: A publicly quoted Ethereum investment vehicle in the US that allows investors to gain exposure to ether without holding the token directly.
2. CME Ether Futures: A cash-settled Ether futures contract listed on the CME Group that allows investors to speculate on the price development of ETH without owning the underlying asset.
3. Ethereum Exchange-Traded Notes (ETNs): Unsecured debt notes issued by financial institutions that track the price of ether and can be held to maturity or purchased and sold at will.

title: It's Time to Build Ethereum Beyond DeFi and Price Focus - Vitalik Buterin - Cryptonews
summary: Vitalik Buterin, co-founder of Ethereum, believes that the platform is more than just decentralized finance (DeFi) and price focus. He argues that Ethereum's primary goal is to have a crypto space with more utility, projects, and ecosystems that combine both finance and non-finance. While DeFi is currently dominant, Buterin notes that there are two primary reasons for this: centralized technology sucks the most in finance, and centralized other things also have issues that become more prominent with high transaction fees. He suggests that now is the time to think beyond DeFi and focus on other non-financial creations such as NFTs, ENS names, social media ecosystems, and decentralized login systems. Buterin also highlights the importance of aligning values and needs for new projects, and exploring ideas such as retroactive public goods funding. Overall, he urges the community to "let's not just do DeFi" and instead focus on combining elements of finance and non-finance for the best applications.

title: The Next Chapter in Yield Farming: Ethereum 2.0 and Sustainability - Cryptonews
summary:

1. Yield farming has become a mainstream DeFi practice, with many projects offering liquidity mining and other incentives to attract users.
2. While yield farming has proven popular, it faces risks such as smart contract bugs, sudden liquidation, and token devaluation.
3. The rise of yield farming has led to concerns about sustainability, as some projects may not be able to deliver on their promised returns.
4. The scalability of DeFi networks, particularly Ethereum, is a major concern, as increased network congestion can lead to slower transaction times and higher fees.
5. The upcoming launch of Ethereum 2.0 is expected to improve the service quality of DeFi by easing congestion on the network, which could benefit the entire DeFi ecosystem.

title: HSBC Hong Kong Launches Support for Bitcoin and Ethereum ETFs - Decrypt
summary: HSBC Hong Kong has launched support for Bitcoin and Ethereum ETFs, allowing customers to trade these derivatives through its "Easy Invest" mobile app. This expansion of access to digital asset derivatives in the emerging Asia crypto hub is seen as a way for HSBC to get ahead and offer a product that is otherwise not allowed in Hong Kong. The ETFs are listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange and invest in futures contracts that trade on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange, providing an easy and transparent way for investors to capture the performance of Bitcoin and Ethereum. The move is seen as a response to robust demand for derivatives among retail investors in Hong Kong, and a way for companies to offer exposure to crypto without opening themselves to regulatory risk in a nascent industry.

title: Ethereum's Vitalik Buterin Has a Layer 3 Vision to Unleash Full Power of Crypto - Cryptonews
summary: Vitalik Buterin, co-founder of Ethereum, has proposed a three-layer scaling vision for the cryptocurrency, with layer 1 (L1) being the base layer, layer 2 (L2) providing scalability solutions on top of L1, and layer 3 (L3) offering customized functionality and scaling. Buterin argues that L3s can provide different roles, such as privacy and weakly-trusted scaling, and that L2s can be used for scaling, while L1 is reserved for security. However, he also acknowledges that the concept of L3s is not new and that others are already discussing their utilization. Buterin suggests that a three-layer structure may not be the best approach and that some roles may be accomplished on the L2 level, while other issues can be solved with existing or proposed approaches.

Cryptocurrency fees have spiked due to high demand, particularly for Bitcoin and Ethereum. Transaction fees have risen by 89% and 260% in the past month, respectively. This has led to longer confirmation times and higher costs for users, potentially pricing out smaller holders. However, competing chains and platforms, such as Cardano and Binance Smart Chain, are enjoying increased popularity due to their lower fees. Ethereum's issues may be benefiting these competitors, but it's unclear how long this situation will last with Ethereum 2.0 promising to lower gas fees.

title: Vitalik Buterin Says High Ethereum Fees Might Be Gone Even Before ETH 2.0 - Cryptonews
summary: Vitalik Buterin proposes a new scaling roadmap for Ethereum that focuses on rollups and sharding as a way to increase scalability before ETH 2.0. Rollups are a scaling technique that keeps transaction data on-chain but pushes computation off-chain, while sharding divides the blockchain's nodes into smaller groups to increase the number of transactions processed per second. Buterin argues that rollups are already viable before sharding and can offer a 100x increase in throughput. He suggests that the Ethereum ecosystem should focus on rollups and sharding as a way to achieve scalability in the short-to-medium term. The proposal has gained support from developers and users, with some arguing that it makes more sense to focus on scalability before Phase 2, which is still years away.

title: Key Ethereum Levels to Watch as ETH Price Pivots $2,100 - Cryptonews
summary: Ethereum (ETH) price has broken above $2,000 for the first time since May 2022, driven by the successful implementation of the Shanghai and Capella upgrades. The price is currently consolidating around $2,100, with gains on the year at around 73%. Key levels to watch include $2,140-60 (resistance), $2,040 (support), and $1,900 (support). A retest of the $1,900 area could be a key test of the market's short-term bullish momentum. The next major resistance area is $2,300, followed by $2,440 and $2,440. The ETH bulls need to push the price above $2,300 to continue the upside bias. Macro conditions are likely to continue favoring major cryptocurrencies, with a Fed rate cutting cycle and deflationary tailwinds from staking and transaction fee burning. The next round of Ethereum upgrades could also provide a tailwind.

title: Bitcoin Price and Ethereum Prediction: 2% Spike - More Upside Ahead? - Cryptonews
summary: Bitcoin and Ethereum have experienced a nearly 2% spike in price, with Bitcoin reaching $27,201 and Ethereum reaching $1,847. title: Cardano's Hoskinson Keeps Bashing Ethereum As ADA Outperforms ETH - Cryptonews
summary: Cardano's founder, Charles Hoskinson, has criticized Ethereum's network effects, claiming they are irrelevant in the long-term. Hoskinson believes that Cardano's decentralized governance model and lower transaction fees will give it an advantage over Ethereum. Despite Ethereum having 2,325 active developers, according to a recent report, Cardano has around 150 active developers and has outperformed Ethereum in the past year, with a 1,300% increase in value compared to Ethereum's 590%. However, Cardano has retreated by 1.5% in the past 24 hours, while Ethereum has gained 1%.

title: Miner Backlash Over Fee Upgrade Provokes A Countermove by Ethereum Devs - Cryptonews
summary: Ethereum developers are proposing to speed up the rollout of Ethereum 2.0 in response to miner backlash against a fee-related upgrade. The proposal would bring forward the blockchain's move to a proof-of-stake consensus mechanism, which would make miners obsolete. This move is seen as an attempt to diminish the influence of some Ethereum miners, but it would also require approval from miners for any proposal to merge sooner with the Ethereum 2.0 Beacon Chain. The proposal from Mikhail Kalinin would build a version of the Ethereum Mainnet with a PoS mechanism on the Ethereum 2.0 Beacon Chain, which could accelerate deployment. However, the process of docking the existing Ethereum chain to the PoS Beacon Chain is likely to be tricky and may require incentivization for miners. The conflict has not hurt the price of ETH, which has risen by around 2% in the past 24 hours and 15% in the past week.

title: Vitalik Buterin Says His Influence Over Ethereum Diminishing, Harder to Make Things Happen - Cryptonews
summary: Vitalik Buterin, co-founder of Ethereum, has revealed that his influence over the project is diminishing, making it harder to push through significant changes. In a recent interview, he shared that his influence has decreased every six months, and he now has less influence than he did six months ago. Buterin attributed this to the increasing number of stakeholders involved in the decision-making process, making it more challenging to get proposals approved. He also mentioned that even he has to convince some members of the Ethereum community to support his ideas.

title: Sleeping Ethereum Whale Awakens and Moves Millions: Is It End of ETH Price Rally? - U.Today
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

A dormant Ethereum whale has awakened, transferring $15.18 million worth of ETH. The address had remained inactive for 6 years and previously received 50,000 ETH in 2017. The whale has a history of strategic selling, and its recent activity has raised concerns about the potential impact on the Ethereum price rally. The market has seen similar instances in the past where large holders have moved substantial volumes, causing market volatility.

title: Polygon and Matic: What is the difference? - crypto.news
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Polygon and MATIC: What's the difference?

* Polygon is a layer-2 scaling infrastructure on the Ethereum blockchain
* MATIC is the native token of the Polygon platform, used for proof-of-stake consensus and transaction fees

MATIC vs. ETH:

* MATIC is not the same as ETH, but rather a native token on the Polygon network
* Transferring MATIC from Ethereum to Polygon without using the bridge service may result in loss of the token

Polygon vs. other layer-2 scaling solutions:

* Polygon sets itself apart by offering developers customization and control over their scaling solutions
* Rival platforms include Solana, Cosmos, and Avalanche, but Polygon's flexibility and customization make it stand out

Polygon's architecture:

* Polygon consists of three core layers: Ethereum, Heimdall, and Bor
* These layers work together to provide a network for Ethereum-compatible blockchains

title: Ethereum Bulls Beware – These 3 Key On-chain Metrics Suggest ETH Price Upside May Be Hard to Sustain - Cryptonews
summary: Ethereum bulls beware: On-chain metrics suggest ETH price upside may be hard to sustain. Despite the recent rally, daily transactions, active addresses, and new address creation remain subdued compared to last year. Until these metrics improve, it may be too early to bet on a new bull market and record highs.

title: Ethereum In ATH Territory Against USD, But Far from ATH Against Bitcoin - Cryptonews
summary: Ethereum (ETH) has reached a new all-time high (ATH) against the US dollar (USD), but is still far from its ATH against Bitcoin (BTC). ETH has rallied 14% in a day, 28% in a week, and 118% in a month, trading at USD 1,417. However, against BTC, ETH is worth only BTC 0.038, a 75% difference. Despite this, ETH seems to be in a rallying mode, aiming higher, while BTC has traded within a range for the past few weeks. Analysts are bullish on ETH, citing increasing transaction volume and decreasing exchange holdings. Some expect ETH to break its record ATH and potentially lead an altseason.

title: Coinbase Mulls Ethereum Collateral Amid Lending Program Expansion - Cryptonews
summary: Coinbase is considering adding ethereum (ETH) as collateral in its lending program, according to CFO Alesia Haas. The company has seen rapid growth in its BTC-collateralized loan product and is assessing the liquidity of other coins, including ethereum, for potential expansion. Coinbase launched its lending program in Q4 2020 and aims to expand it to multiple assets, foreign markets, and increase the balances it lends out. The company currently offers staking on four assets and plans to offer it on more assets as new cryptocurrencies are introduced.

title: Ethereum Price Prediction as ETH Sees $8.3 Billion Trading Volume Come In – Here's Where It's Heading Next - Cryptonews
summary: Ethereum (ETH) price is predicted to retest its 21-day moving average in the $1,250s, with a potential drop to $1,200 if bears gain momentum. The cryptocurrency is still up 20% from its November lows but has erased its December gains. PayPal's partnership with MetaMask may not have had a significant impact on the price. Other altcoins, such as FightOut (FGHT), Dash 2 Trade (D2T), and Calvaria (RIA), are gaining traction in presales, offering quicker returns to investors.

title: How to Use Layer-2 Solutions to Save on Ethereum Fees: Immutable X - Cryptonews
summary: Immutable X is a layer-2 scaling solution for Ethereum that addresses the network's scalability issues for NFTs. It uses ZK-Rollups and Validium to process thousands of off-chain transactions and achieve instant transaction resolution, without compromising security or user custody. Unlike other layer-2 solutions, Immutable X does not rely on energy-intensive computations, but instead uses staking to secure the protocol. The solution has already been adopted by numerous NFT marketplaces and games, and offers gas-free transactions with instant confirmation.

title: Ethereum's Vitalik Buterin Now Bitcoin Price Analyst Too - Cryptonews
summary: Vitalik Buterin, co-founder of Ethereum, has joined the debate on the stock-to-flow (S2F) model, which predicts a significant rise in Bitcoin's price based on the coin's halving events. Buterin criticized the model, arguing that it's unfalsifiable due to the inconsistency in price increases. PlanB, the model's author, disagreed, stating that the model makes Bitcoin scarcer and the price increase is due to the average price levels rather than the peaks. The discussion has sparked a debate among community members, with some agreeing with Buterin and others defending the S2F model. Despite Buterin's skepticism, the price of Bitcoin has still seen significant gains since the last halving in 2016, with a 1,364% increase in the past four years.

title: Bitcoin Tests USD 24K, Ethereum Eyes USD 1.8K, Altcoins Rally - Cryptonews
summary: Bitcoin (BTC) price surged to $24K, Ethereum (ETH) reached $1.8K, and altcoins rallied. BTC cleared the $23.5K resistance zone and is currently trading near $24K, up 5% in a day and 3% in a week. ETH climbed above $1.750 and is up 5% in a day and 8% in a week. Other altcoins, such as ADA, BNB, SOL, DOGE, and XRP, are also rising, with some gaining over 10% in a day. The total market capitalization is up 5% in a day and 10% in a week.

title: Ethereum Won't Hide From Quantum Computers Behind PoS Shield - Cryptonews
summary: Ethereum won't hide from quantum computers behind its PoS shield, as both mechanisms used in consensus mechanisms and signature systems are vulnerable to quantum attacks. While PoW cryptoassets like Bitcoin are theoretically vulnerable to 51% attacks, PoS cryptoassets are also vulnerable to signature attacks. Current cryptographic research is aware of the threat and solutions are being developed, but it may take time for the Bitcoin community to react to the threat.

title: What is ERC-20? A comprehensive guide - OKX
summary: ERC-20 is a technical standard for creating and issuing tokens on the Ethereum blockchain. It was proposed by Fabian Vogelsteller in 2015 and has since become the de facto standard for smart contract tokens on the Ethereum network. ERC-20 tokens are fungible, meaning they can be interchanged with other tokens of the same value, and they confer governance rights to holders. The standard also promotes interoperability, security, transparency, and high liquidity. However, it has some limitations, such as limited flexibility and high transaction fees. Popular ERC-20 tokens include Tether (USDT), Uniswap (UNI), and Binance (BNB).

title: Ethereum and Lido Finance Dominate Revenue Generation as Prices Soar - Cryptonews
summary: Ethereum and Lido Finance are leading revenue generators in the DeFi space, according to Token Terminal data. Ethereum generated $370.6 million in 30-day revenue, while Lido Finance generated $6.1 million. Both saw significant growth in the past month, with Ethereum increasing by 81.9% and Lido Finance increasing by 23.8%. Ethereum also dominates in the longer-term, with $1 billion in revenue collected in the past 180 days. Lido Finance has a TVL of $13.1 billion on the Ethereum network. ETH is up 3.2% in the past 24 hours and 5% in the past week, but remains almost unchanged on a 30-day basis.

title: Binance Chain is On 'a Parabola', Surpassing Ethereum in Several Metrics - Cryptonews
summary: Binance Smart Chain (BSC) has been outperforming Ethereum (ETH) in several network metrics, including daily active addresses, daily transactions, and average gas price. BSC has seen a significant increase in daily active addresses, unique addresses, and daily transactions, while Ethereum's growth is slower and less parabolic. BSC's average gas price is also lower than Ethereum's. Analysts attribute BSC's success to its decentralized nature and lower fees, which are attracting more users and projects. However, some argue that Ethereum's growth is still significant and that the two chains are not necessarily rivals.

title: How to Use Layer-2 Solutions to Save on Ethereum Fees: Optimism - Cryptonews
summary: Optimism is a layer-2 scaling solution for Ethereum that reduces gas fees by moving transactions off-chain and only publishing transaction data on-chain. It uses Optimistic Rollups and fraud proofs to achieve this, and is compatible with EVM-compatible contracts. To use Optimism, users can connect to the layer-2 network through MetaMask and bridge their ERC-20 assets to Optimistic Ethereum using the Optimism Gateway. Dozens of dapps have already adopted Optimism, including Uniswap, Synthetix, and 1inch. Gas fees on Optimism are expected to improve over time, but may increase if demand rises.

title: Ethereum Classic Pumps 26% as Miners Make Switch ahead of ETH Merge - Cryptonews
summary: Ethereum Classic (ETC) has surged 26% in the past 24 hours as miners switch to the network ahead of Ethereum's (ETH) transition to a Proof-of-Stake (PoS) consensus algorithm. The increase in hashrate has led to a new all-time high for ETC. The reason for the pump is that miners are looking for alternative chains to mine as their ETH mining hardware will become obsolete after The Merge. ETC offers a more secure mining environment as it will take a larger group to form a 51% attack majority. Top mining pools have already expressed support for ETC.

title: Ethereum Price Prediction as ETH Shoots Up 6.5% in 7 Days – How High Can it Go? - Cryptonews
summary:

Analysts predict that the price could continue to rise, potentially reaching $1,400 or even $1,800 in the near future. However, they also caution that Ethereum is still in a long-term downtrend and may face resistance at higher levels.

In addition to the price increase, Ethereum developers are shutting down the Ropsten testnet, and the closure will be followed by the shuttering of the Rinkeby testnet in mid-2023. This means that developers building on these testnets must migrate their projects to the Goerli and Sepolia testnets.

Dash 2 Trade is an analytics and social trading platform that offers unique features such as trading signals, social sentiment, and on-chain indicators. RobotEra is a Sandbox-style Metaverse that enables

title: How to Use Layer-2 Solutions to Save on Ethereum Fees: StarkWare - Cryptonews
summary: StarkWare is a developer of layer-2 scaling solutions for the Ethereum network, which aims to improve scalability and reduce transaction fees. Their products, StarkEx and StarkNet, use ZK-STARKs and ZK-Rollups to enable high throughput and fast transactions, while also providing privacy and security. StarkWare's solutions are already being used by several notable decentralized applications (dapps), including DiversiFi, dYdX, and Sorare. The company's technology is designed to be quantum-resistant and trustless, and it differs from other Ethereum layer-2 scaling solutions in its use of ZK-STARKs and ZK-Rollups.

title: Ethereum's Vitalik Buterin Now a Billionaire as ETH Prices Surge - Cryptonews
summary: Vitalik Buterin, co-founder of Ethereum, has become a billionaire as ETH prices surge to a new all-time high. His main wallet now holds over $1 billion worth of ETH, with an additional $2.8 million in a second account. Buterin's crypto wealth extends beyond Ethereum, with holdings in other cryptocurrencies and investments in companies. The price of ETH has rallied 49% in a month and 1,388% in a year, with many on Reddit congratulating Buterin on his success.

title: Ethereum Price Prediction as ETH Shoots Up 11% – $2,000 Incoming? - Cryptonews
summary: Ethereum (ETH) price surged 11% in 24 hours, reaching $1,530 at the time of writing. The cryptocurrency market cap exceeded $1 trillion, with Bitcoin (BTC) breaking past $20K for the first time since October 7. Ether's gains come amid a market recovery, with traders taking advantage of the increased volatility. Technical indicators suggest ETH is in bullish territory, with the Relative Strength Index (RSI) at 59 and the Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) line in the bullish zone. title: T-Mobile Parent Company Launches Ethereum Staking Validator - Cryptonews
summary: T-Mobile's parent company, Deutsche Telekom (DT), has launched an Ethereum staking validator through its subsidiary T-Systems MMS. The move aims to cement DT's presence in the blockchain space and contribute to the transparency of the second-largest blockchain network. T-Systems will also provide liquid Ether (ETH) staking services through a partnership with StakeWise, a decentralized autonomous organization (DAO). This partnership will see DT participate in the governance of the decentralized application (dApp) and contribute to the safety of the Ethereum ecosystem. Analysts expect more institutional adoption of ETH and the Ethereum blockchain, and the partnership is seen as a novelty for DT.

title: One Old Presentation by Buterin Brings an Unresolved Ethereum Issue Again - Cryptonews
summary: Vitalik Buterin's old presentation at a 2014 conference has resurfaced, sparking debate about Ethereum's status as a security. Buterin described ETH as "sort of like the reserve currency of the network," but noted that the sale had to be delayed due to legal reasons, including the entity registered in Switzerland. Andrew Bailey and Hasu have brought up old statements arguing that Ethereum's presale was likely a securities issuance, while Peter van Valkenburgh disagreed. Gensler has asked SEC staff to investigate ICOs, with Ripple currently battling the SEC over XRP's status. Meanwhile, Brad Garlinghouse questioned how the market can have clarity on ETH's status when Hinman recently filed an affidavit saying the SEC has not taken a position. Cryptonews reached out to the Ethereum Foundation for comment.

title: HSBC's Hong Kong customers can now trade Bitcoin, Ethereum futures ETFs - CryptoSlate
summary: HSBC customers in Hong Kong can now buy Bitcoin and Ethereum futures ETFs through the bank's platform. This expansion of local users' exposure to cryptocurrencies comes as Hong Kong positions itself as a crypto-friendly jurisdiction, with initiatives to encourage digital asset participation and regulatory calls for banks to treat crypto clients fairly.

title: Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM): Everything you need to know - OKX
summary:
The EVM (Ethereum Virtual Machine) offers several benefits, including:

1. Security: The EVM prevents malicious activities from attacking the network, enabling the execution of smart contracts and other automated services in a secure and trustworthy platform.
2. Decentralization: The EVM is decentralized, meaning anyone can create a smart contract on Ethereum without permission.
3. Trustworthiness: The EVM enables developers to build and deploy decentralized services and applications, recently gaining massive popularity.
4. Large crypto ecosystem: Ethereum has the largest crypto ecosystem, making it the gold standard for Dapp creation and smart contract deployment.
5. Gas fees: The EVM's gas fees play a crucial role in processing transactions on the Ethereum blockchain, preventing malicious attacks and ensuring the network's security.
6. EVM use cases: The EVM has various use cases, including ERC-20 tokens, decentralized exchanges (DEXs), NFTs, DeFi lending, and decentralized autonomous organizations (DAOs).

title: One Ethereum Classic Dev Team Quits With Empty Pockets, Others Stay - Cryptonews
summary: One Ethereum Classic (ETC) development team, ETCDEV, has shut down due to lack of funds, but other teams are still working on the project. The ETC community has clarified that the shutdown of ETCDEV does not affect the future of Ethereum Classic. Other teams, such as ETC Cooperative, are still hiring and have open job positions. ETCDEV had planned to focus on scalability improvements, light clients for IoT and mobile, interoperability with other blockchains, and improving cryptography on the EVM. Despite the shutdown of ETCDEV, Ethereum Classic's price has suffered a prolonged sell-off along with the rest of the crypto market.

title: Bitcoin Price and Ethereum Prediction; Choppy Sessions in Play as New Year 2023 Approaches - Cryptonews
summary: Bitcoin and Ethereum prices are stable as 2022 comes to a close, with little volatility. Bitcoin is trading in a narrow range of $16,450 to $16,750, while Ethereum is oscillating between $1,180 and $1,200. Despite the bearish trend, some altcoins are making headlines in the new year, including FightOut, Dash 2 Trade, and C+Charge. FightOut is a platform that rewards users for exercise time, while Dash 2 Trade provides real-time trading data and social trading features. C+Charge is a blockchain-based technology that rewards electric vehicle owners for charging and driving their vehicles.

title: EIP-1559 Three Weeks Later: ETH 100,000 Burned, Supply Grows - Cryptonews
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

Ethereum's EIP-1559 upgrade has burned over 100,000 ETH in transaction fees, growing the total supply of ETH. Despite this, the total supply of ETH continues to increase, with over 40% of transactions using the new EIP-1559 fee mechanism. The upgrade has not lowered ETH fees, with average fees reaching their highest level since May 2021 due to the NFT craze. The hashrate has also continued to climb, reaching 634.5 Thash/s. ETH is trading at USD 3,126, down 2% in a day and up 3% in a week.

title: Put Away the Ethereum 'Knives,' We Come in Peace – Solana Co-founder - Cryptonews
summary: Solana co-founder Raj Gokal rejects the notion that Solana is an "Ethereum killer" and instead believes that there is room for multiple blockchain protocols to coexist and grow. Despite the competition, Gokal believes that Solana and Ethereum can work together and grow the movement as a whole. The exchange was sparked by a Twitter thread from Chris Burniske, co-founder of Placeholder, who expressed skepticism that everyone in crypto would get along and noted that "knives are fully out" in the competition between layer 1 protocols. However, Gokal insists that Solana is not trying to "kill" Ethereum and instead aims to grow the movement and expand the user base. At the time of writing, Solana trades at $230, up 11,422% in the past year, while Ethereum trades at $4,747, up 925% in the past year.

title: Ethereum Classic: Which way will triumphant bulls head next? - AMBCrypto News
summary: Ethereum Classic (ETC) has been on a bullish streak, with a 16.5% gain over the past 48 hours. The cryptocurrency has broken through resistance at $17.66 and is currently trading at $18.84. The rising open interest and increasing trading volume suggest that the bullish momentum may continue. However, the funding rate has been fluctuating, and buyers should be cautious to avoid a potential bearish reversal. The RSI has entered the overbought zone, and the CMF has shown a positive reaction, indicating continued support for the bullish rally.

title: XRPL or Ethereum? Dev Compares Two Approaches to Programmability - U.Today
summary: In a recent tweet, Wo Jake, an independent developer of XRP Ledger and its flagship second layer solution Evernode, highlighted the differences in programmability between XRP Ledger and Ethereum. Jake explained that while Ethereum has become feature-rich due to "standards and cool stuff" built since its launch in 2015, XRP Ledger's design has a variety of features "natively." Jake believes that the combination of XRP Ledger's core design, Hooks functionality, and L2 scaling tools unlocks significant opportunities for flexibility and leverage. However, there are still functions waiting to be implemented into XRP Ledger's technical design. Additionally, XRPL Hooks, a simple smart contract for XRP Ledger, recently passed an audit with no major bugs disclosed, and the discussion is now centered around the next phases of Hooks Amendment implementation in mainnet.

title: Azuki Expands With New 20K Ethereum NFT Collection, Elementals - Decrypt
summary: Azuki, a popular Ethereum NFT collection, is expanding with a new collection called Elementals. The new collection will feature 20,000 NFTs and will be available for purchase on Tuesday, with a starting price of 2 ETH (approximately $3,750) per NFT. Existing Azuki holders have already been airdropped a token for one of the Elementals, and the art for the collection has not yet been revealed. The Elementals sale will be conducted via a Dutch auction, with the price dropping every 5 minutes until the supply is depleted. The final sale price will be the price that everyone pays, and earlier buyers will be refunded the difference. The collection will consist of four tiers of Elementals, each with a higher chance of revealing rare traits, and will be comprised of randomized attributes of varying rarity. This is the first full follow-up collection to Azuki, which has racked up over $1 billion worth of trading volume and has been quick to capitalize on its success by extending the IP into other realms, including a partnership with Line Friends

title: Demand for ETH Staking Soars Despite Nearly Month-Long Waiting Period - Cryptonews
summary: Demand for ETH staking has surged since the implementation of the Shanghai upgrade, with the waiting period for new validators increasing to 27 days. Despite this, the number of ETH tokens being staked has continued to rise, with a current participation rate of around 18%. The addition of withdrawal flexibility has reduced the risk for investors and could potentially lead to a staking participation rate of 50%. This would result in 38.4 million ETH tokens moving into the less liquid staking contract, causing a scarcity of unstaked ETH and a tailwind for the price. Furthermore, the Ethereum network is experiencing deflation, with the ETH burn rate surging above 8% earlier this month, further supporting the long-term price of ETH.

title: Ethereum is Experiencing an Unintended Chain Split - Cryptonews
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum is experiencing an unintended chain split due to a bug in older versions of the Geth client. The bug may lead to double spend exploits, but most miners have already upgraded to the latest version. The Ethereum Foundation is encouraging all node runners to update their Geth clients to the latest version. The bug was discovered prior to August 24 and was immediately shared and acknowledged by the Go Ethereum team.

title: Turn Your Old Smartphone into Ethereum Hardware Wallet - Cryptonews
summary: Parity Technologies has developed an app, Parity Signer, that turns old smartphones into hardware wallets for Ethereum and Ethereum Classic. The app generates and stores private keys, allowing users to convert their old smartphones into secure storage devices. The app supports multiple networks, including Ethereum, Ethereum Classic, Kovan, and Ropsten. Users can generate and store multiple private keys, and the app includes new features such as support for Kusama CC2 network and Universal Offline Signatures. The app also includes improved visualization and faster account generation. Users are advised to reset their phones to delete accounts before installing the new version, and to never connect the phone to the internet.
